text: I’m just trying to see if there a way for serve Webp and compression for images. With some serverside code.

typically HS takes care of that for us, all webp-compliant images get converted and served in that format in supported browsers automatically. Compression might be an interesting use-case, but I'm not sure serverless functions is the best tool for that job... might be interesting to leverage the HS CLI as a part of a cron job or some other regularly executed script though to download a certain folder from the file manager, run a compression utility, then re-upload.
Yea running a CLI on a cron for image compression and management might be a good thing to look into. Do you know anything about lazy loading on HubSpot?
Does anyone know of a tool in HubSpot that will allow for lazyloading media and content
Hi Don this may help you out a bit <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/speed#images>
and here’s what HubSpot already does for you: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/speed#what-does-HubSpot-handle-for-you->
Does this happen after the page is fully loaded?

This script is designed to lazy load images. It tests the browser and if it sees that is supports native lazyloading it will do so that way. Otherwise it will load the image ion scroll with javascript.
<@U38EZFVFE> Great Job! would it be sufficient to put this script in the Global Head script in HubSpot settings?
you would need to do some mods to the image tags
